DOC.brief_title: Complex Aortic Aneurysm Repair Using Physician Modified Endografts Custom Made Devices
DOC.detailed_description: Endovascular repair complex aortic aneurysm limit need maintain blood flow critical organ receive blood aorta , kidney , liver intestine . While commercially available device may treat patient device may suitable available give patient . In study use custom make device manufacture Cook , Inc , Zenith t-Branch device off-the-shelf , FDA approve device alter create fenestration ( hole ) stent graft allow additional stent insert blood vessel supply blood critical organ . Determination type endograft use base patient 's anatomy perceive urgency need repair . This decision make study team confirm 3rd party reviewer investigator study team . After ensure patient meet inclusion exclusion criterion participation CARPE-CMD study , perceive urgency repair evaluate give 8-10 week require time manufacture CMD device . If patient 's aneurysm symptomatic , discretion treat surgeon , patient deem safe wait 8 week repair , patient consider non-urgent . Non-urgent patient undergo repair CMD device . DOC.criteria: A patient may suitable inclusion study patient least one following : 1 . Aortic aortoiliac aneurysm diameter ≥5.5 cm 2 . Aortic aortoiliac aneurysm history growth ≥1.0 cm per year , clinical indication aneurysm repair base symptom General Inclusion Criteria 1 . Can treat currently available nonmodified approved device 2 . Symptomatic presentation unsafe wait time necessary obtain currently available nonmodified approved device 3 . At least 18 year age 4 . Not pregnant breastfeed 5 . Willing able comply five year followup 6 . Willing able provide inform consent prior enrollment 7 . No systemic local infection may increase risk endovascular graft infection 8 . High risk open surgical repair base factor : a. Anatomic . Previous abdominal surgery ii . Previous leftsided thoracotomy ( propose open repair would require dissection thoracic aorta ) iii . Previous aortic surgery b. Physiologic i. ASA Category III high ii . Age > 70 year iii . Current tobacco use iv . Previous myocardial infarction , coronary artery disease , coronary artery stent v. Coronary stress test reversible perfusion defect vi . Congestive heart failure vii . COPD Exclusion Criteria Medical Exclusion Criteria 1 . Baseline creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl 2 . Cultural objection receipt blood blood product 3 . Allergy sensitivity stainless steel , polyester , polypropylene , solder ( tin , silver ) , gold , nitinol 4 . Anaphylactic reaction contrast adequately premedicated 5 . Uncorrectable coagulopathy 6 . Unstable angina ( define angina progressive increase symptom , new onset rest nocturnal angina , onset prolonged angina ) 7 . Patient major surgical interventional procedure plan ≤30 day aneurysm repair 8 . Patient history connective tissue disease ( e.g. , Marfan 's Ehler'sDanlos syndrome ) 9 . Patient active malignancy 10 . Patient life expectancy less two year Anatomical Exclusion Criteria 1 . Significant occlusive disease , tortuosity , calcification would prevent endovascular access 2 . Proximal neck length ≤25 mm 3 . Proximal neck , measure outer wall outer wall sectional image ( CT ) 1 . For use Zenith Flex : diameter > 32 mm < 18 mm 2 . For use Zenith TX2 : diameter > 38 mm < 24 mm ( proximal distal neck diameter ) 4 . Proximal neck angulate 60 degree relative long axis aneurysm 5 . Proximal neck diameter change length proximal seal zone > 4 mm 6 . Proximal seal site circumferential thrombus/atheroma 7 . Iliac artery diameter , measure inner wall inner wall sectional image ( CT ) < 7.0 mm point along access length ( prior deployment ) 8 . Ipsilateral iliac artery fixation site diameter , measure inner wall sectional image ( CT ) > 21 mm distal fixation site 9 . Iliac artery distal fixation site < 10 mm length 10 . Nonbifurcated segment artery stented < 15 mm length 11 . Artery stented maximum diameter < 3 mm > 10 mm vessel ostium 12 . Inability maintain least one patent hypogastric artery 13 . Bilateral renal artery stenosis > 50 % 14 . Superior mesenteric artery stenosis > 50 %
